data.title: Nothing but broth
data.text: I spent almost 10 minutes trying to find somewhere to park to pick up a to-go order, which was a bowl of minestrone soup, side salad, tea, and breadsticks. After all the frustration of trying to find a parking place, when I got back to work and opened the bowl of soup, there were 4 noodles, a piece of carrot, 2 green beans, 4 beans, and tomato flavored broth. $11 paid for a bowl of broth and salad. When I called to complain the girl that answered the phone laughed and said she would get a manager. On hold 3-1/2 minutes, no manager. First and last time to order. Pretty bad impression made for someone new to the area.

data.title: Lunch Stop
data.text: Heard a lot about this place and has lots of local history. Had the pizza and it was average. Maybe the rest of the menu is good, but it did not meet the stories I heard about it.

data.title: A little bit of Italy in the middle of west Texas
data.text: Luigi's is a great little piece of Italy, complete with wine bottle candle sticks and checkered table cloths. This ambience-packed restaurant is a favorite of locals with posters and pictures of Midland Community Theater and Midland Jazz Festivals from 60+ years ago gracing the walls. The floors used to be covered with sawdust!  The menu is relatively varied with Italian dishes of all sorts. While it's nothing fancy, it's very adequate for either lunch or a nice dinner and prices are reasonable.The pizza is a delicious thin crust type, topped with whatever you want. Lasagna, spaghetti & meatballs or sauce, manicotti, etc. are all good.  Wine and cocktails are available, but only two drinks per person are allowed in memory of an owner's wife who was killed by a drug affected driver.

data.title: Long time Stand By Downtowner Hangout
data.text: Have been a patron for many years, notices over the last six months while salads and pizza are still great, the main dishes has been very inconsistent. Don't know if change in personnel, but change is apparent.

data.title: Excellent Italian
data.text: Great little place, which has been around for ages. Italian food is delicious and the place has a very homey environment

data.title: Authentic Italian, plus great pizza!
data.text: This downtown jewel is a local favorite!  Come early for lunch.  If you are within a few blocks just walk, as parking is a premium (like most downtowns).

data.title: AMAZING
data.text: I always love Luigi's.  We have been going here for special occasions since I was a little girl.  Its still the same great food and great atmosphere.   One of Midland's treasures.

data.title: Seriously needs a makeover
data.text: I found Luigi's disappointing. The interior is not very attractive The walls are decorated with memorabilia from the 70's and early 80's and the ceiling tiles are water stained. I had a pastrami sandwich and it was not very good. It gives the impression that at some time in the past it was a good restaurant, but the management has lost interest and have not tried to improve things in years.

data.title: One of my FAVORITE Midland restaurants.
data.text: I haven't had a bad meal here! I love their pizzas, chicken parm AND spaghetti. Also, they have yummy bread sticks that rival Olive Garden any day.

data.title: Good food, family friendly
data.text:
This is a favorite spot of ours when we drive from California to Fort Worth. Open late, friendly staff, good food. 
Easy to get to from the highway

data.title: Best Italian Resturant in Midland
data.text: Luigis is a Midland tradition! Spaghetti, Lasagne, Ravioli, Pizza...they have the best of it all! Very laid back atmosphere and very good food...an excellent combination! Very reasonable prices, too!

data.title: Awesome pizza!
data.text: The food is great but their pizza with sauer kraut is my favorite. Call in orders are always ready and when you dine in, the service is great.

data.title: One of our favorites
data.text:
We love going to Luigi's, great food and service, the only downside is hard to find parking.
I recommend going early because it fills up fast...it's everybody's favorite it seems.

data.title: What passes for Italian food in Midland
data.text: While the food isn't bad, you can get much better Italian food in the Basin at Mi Piaci or Venezia, and infinitely better pizza at Jersey Girl. For a downtown lunch spot with absolutely no parking, its not bad. Try the antipasto salad, its surprisingly large and flavorful.

data.title: Midland Traditional Italian Restaurant
data.text: Forego the chain food restaurants and enjoy delicious thin-crust pizza and traditional Italian fare. The restaurant is furnished with red-checked table clothes and Chianti bottles with dripping candles -- truly looks like it did in the 60's. The restaurant is small but the wait is worth it, you will be amazed at the steady stream of customers picking up pizza for carry-out.  Parking can be an issue at lunch time but lunchtime parking can be an issue for any downtown restaurant.  Restaurant only allows two alcoholic beverages per customer.  Great venue for family and friends or business.

data.title: Midland Staple
data.text: Wonderful food.  Wonderful atmosphere.  This is one of Midland's longest running restaurants and has stood the test of time.  The food is always great and the quaint, dimly lit dining room gives that old school charm.  Seating is limited, so call for reservations.

data.title: Good food, great downtown location
data.text: Stopped in for dinner after meetings in downtown. Parking was not an issue for dinner and easy to get in an out before scheduled flight. Lots of interesting photos and info on the wall to go along with a nice lasagna. Good prices and service.

data.title: Awful food, good service
data.text: Let me preface this by saying from all the hype on here and that I heard from local people I was excited to eat here. Walking in the door gave the ambiance of a small NY Italian place. Again, good. Wine selection was decent, nothing special but acceptable. Ordered meatball side and a pizza. Meatballs where clearly frozen store bought and reheated. No flavor and very underwhelming. Then the pizza. I have had better pizza eating Hunt Brothers at a gas station. It was aweful. Long story short I gave it two stars because the service was good but I will not be eating there again.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: Great food, service, price, and atmosphere. We ordered the pizza snack:  salad, pasta, and half a pizza. The sauce is some of the best we've ever had. We'll definitely come back!

data.title: Classic Midland
data.text: Luigi's is a little part of Midland history sandwiched between the more modern downtown district. The ambiance is second to none. My daughter absolutely loves the pizza here and I like the canneloni. Good food and decor right out of the movies.
